meanings.definition: Of a color intermediate between black and white.
meanings.sent1: The sky turned gray before the storm.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur was a soft gray color.
meanings.sent3: The gray clouds made the day feel gloomy.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as gray as the overcast sky.
meanings.sent5: The old man's gray beard was long and wispy.

meanings.definition: Dull and nondescript; lacking in interest or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The presentation was so gray that everyone fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: The gray movie failed to capture the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: The gray wall paint made the room feel boring.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were as gray as the dull sky outside.
meanings.sent5: The gray textbook was a snooze fest to read.

meanings.sent1: Over time, his hair began to gray at the temples.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph had started to gray around the edges.
meanings.sent3: The paint on the fence started to gray with age.
meanings.sent4: The sky began to gray as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The fabric will gray over time with exposure to sunlight.
